skillTree.localised_description: An extremely light yet resilient material, Ithilmar gives the same protection as heavy steel, but without slowing down its wearer.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

skillTree.localised_description: Its forehead adorned with a spiral horn, this noble mount carries the Spellsinger where their magical gifts are needed most.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

skillTree.localised_description: Fly on your wings, like an eagle. Touch the sun. Track the foe, ambush, and defeat.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

skillTree.localised_description: The Trickster God knows all manner of ploys and ruses that can be used to counter missile attacks.
Knowledge can be used as a shield against magical attack.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: The most powerful Spellsingers can convince the forest to change its shape.

skillTree.localised_description: The Spellsingers are connected to an ancient intelligence, greater than any in the world.
Wards against mundane dangers. There are far worse things the Spellsingers must contend with.
Her presence empowers the forest, even in the midst of the most bitter winters.
To be able to see the future is to be able to change it.

effects.description:
Hero action success chance: +3%
	(own characters in province)

Hero action success chance: +6%
	(own characters in province)

Hero action success chance: +10%
	(own characters in province)

skillTree.localised_description: Should she be wounded, the power of the Mage Queen will protect her.
Thereafter, Isha has watched the mortal children keenly, ever alert to ways in which she might aid them.
Trees live for thousands of years and have very long memories. When called to fight, centuries of pent-up wrath are unleashed.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Awakening of the Wood"

skillTree.localised_description: Even the simplest of spells can bring forth the full bloom of renewal, reinvigorating and healing the broken and bleeding.
The Wizard draws wholesome energies from the soil, imbuing companions with the natural resilience of the earth.

target_if: Hit point replenishment cap not reached
Hit point replenishment cap not reached

skillTree.localised_description: Prickly gorse bursts from the ground around the caster's allies, protecting them from attack like a spiky, living shield.

skillTree.localised_description: By speaking Druthandor's name the Wizard is able to heal allies' injuries much faster than by natural means.

skillTree.localised_description: This spell causes gnarled, fibrous hands to emerge from beneath the ground, dragging the foe to a claustrophobic, suffocating end.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
	(all units in army)
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Drain the winds of magic before the enemy can turn them against us.

Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve change: -10% when increasing

skillTree.localised_description: Practiced in the art of casting; always with a spell at the ready.
Your life is balanced on the edge of a knife when drawing from the winds. Too swift, and the winds will claim your life. Too slow, and the enemy will.

skillTree.localised_description: Oft-times, though you may have much, what you want the most is what your rivals have; such envy focuses the mind and creativity.

Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 6%

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of a powerful figure extolling death and blasphemies can bring enemy ranks to their knees.

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Those whom the Mage Queen has favoured fight as if powered by her hand.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

effects.description:
Experience gain: +5% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +10% chance of wounding aggressors

Ambush defence chance: +10%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Trees live for thousands of years and have very long memories. When called to fight, centuries of pent-up wrath are unleashed.
Atop a great pyramid in the highest heaven, Asuryan watches over the world alone and has never been seen by mortals.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -4% for Great Eagle and Hawk Rider units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Whatever the motivation, legend tells that when Asuryan learned of Hoeth's actions, he rebuked the Lord of Wisdom, and in punishment, set much of Hoeth's great library ablaze.
As the goddess of nature, Isha taught the Elves how to care for the land and gain a plentiful harvest.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +5%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: By tradition, she is the only goddess to any longer walk the mortal world, and there are tales of her coming to the aid of those lost amidst the mists of Yvresse or upon the trackless ocean.
It is claimed that she reads the intention written in the heart of every elf and judges them not by their deeds, but by their hearts desire.
The Elf legends tell that Loec often saves the souls of the dead from Slaanesh by tricking the Dark Prince out of his prize.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
	(all units in army)

Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve change: -10% when increasing
	(enemy armies in region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Enslaved to Khaine's will, Vaul is forced to make weapons of extraordinary power for the War God's eternal battle against the great enemy.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Wardancer and Bladesinger units
	(all units in army)
